# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(String(text), r"\s+"))
        # If adding the new word to the current line exceeds the text width,
        # start a new line.
        if (length(current_line) + length(word)) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    # Add the last line to the result
    push!(lines, current_line)
    
    return lines
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long sentence that we want to wrap. Let's see how it works."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
for line in wrapped_text
    println(line)
end
